sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Find the derivative of the function f(x) = 4x^5 using the power rule.
message_2:
The power rule states that if f(x) = x^n, then the derivative f'(x) = nx^(n-1). 

In this case, f(x) = 4x^5, so n = 5. Applying the power rule, we get:

f'(x) = 5 * 4x^(5-1) = 20x^4
